Hi everyone @IA,

I finally found the time to commit my JerichoHTMLExtracto=
r to the
SourceForge feature request section (id: 1573708). If anyone consi=
ders
it useful, finds any bugs or any major design-shortcomings feel free
t=
o report.
It basically performs all the tasks that ExtractorHTML does - plu=
s
filling out FORMs default values. The form handling part might still
not =
be perfect but seems to work just fine in my environment.

Regards
  Olaf F=
reyer


> I also started work on a custom extractor based on HTMLExtractor.=
 
> My primary goal is to be able to fill out FORMs with default values.
> =
I decided to not take the "regular expression"-way as the
> HTMLExtractor c=
urrently does, but base my work on jerichoHTML parser
> (http://jerichohtml=
.sourceforge.net). 
> The current results seem quite promising (it is just =
a few percent
> slower than the HTMLExtractor but uses significantly less m=
emory and
> it passes all unit test that HTMLExtractor does).
> If everythi=
ng fares well I might be able to provide my extractor to
> the cummunity ne=
xt month.
> 
> Olaf Freyer
>
